title: Gyoza 餃子
description: Gyoza are Japanese dumplings, first pan-fried until golden brown and crispy, then steamed, resulting in a tender chew and juicy, cooked filling.

title: Kushikatsu 串カツ
description: Also called kushiage, kushikatsu refers to deep-fried skewers of fruit, proteins, or vegetables served with a thin, savory dipping sauce.

title: Saba Misoni 鯖の味噌煮
description: Saba no misoni is a popular dish of mackerel fish simmered in a miso and ginger-based sauce.

title: Kakuni 角煮
description: Kakuni, or buta no kakuni, is a rich dish of pork belly stewed in soy sauce until the pork becomes succulent and melts with every bite.

title: Yakisoba 焼きそば
description: Japanese yakisoba is a stir-fry dish consisting of “Chinese-style” buckwheat noodles, diced meat (usually pork belly, but sometimes chicken), and veggies, tossed with a thick, sweet sauce similar to Worcestershire sauce.

title: Moyashi Itame もやし
description: Moyashi Itame is made with pork belly and bean sprouts.

title: Sake サーモン
description: Sake is another fish that is popularly served as sashimi. Its bright orange flesh is tender, fatty and delicious.

title: Tako たこ
description: Tako is another typical item in Japanese cuisine; the tentacles are often thinly sliced and served as sashimi.
